title: Greek Mythology Basics
description: Test your knowledge of ancient Greek myths!

questions.question: Where do the Greek gods live?
questions.explanation: Mount Olympus is the mythical home of the twelve Olympian gods in Greek mythology.

questions.question: Who is the king of the Greek gods?
questions.explanation: Zeus is the king of the gods, ruler of Mount Olympus, and god of the sky and thunder.

questions.question: The Titans ruled before the Olympian gods.
questions.explanation: The Titans were the elder gods who ruled before Zeus and the Olympians overthrew them.

questions.question: What is the name of the Greek underworld?
questions.explanation: The underworld is called Hades, named after its ruler. Tartarus is the deepest dungeon within it.

questions.question: What food grants immortality to the gods?
questions.explanation: Ambrosia is the food of the gods, and nectar is their drink, both granting immortality.

questions.question: Zeus, Poseidon, and Hades are brothers.
questions.explanation: The three brothers divided the world after defeating the Titans: Zeus got the sky, Poseidon the sea, and Hades the underworld.

questions.question: Who ferries souls across the River Styx?
questions.explanation: Charon is the ferryman who carries souls of the deceased across the River Styx to the underworld.

questions.question: How many Olympian gods are there traditionally?
questions.explanation: There are traditionally twelve Olympian gods who resided on Mount Olympus.
